content.raw:
I'd prefer not to completely fill the `gzlog` file with this message, since it will be generated for each non-revolute/prismatic joint at every timestep.

I think there could be a message if you try to call `GetForceTorque` on an unsupported joint, but `CacheForceTorque` shouldn't generate messages if it's always called.
content.html:
I'd prefer not to completely fill the gzlog file with this message, since it will be generated for each non-revolute/prismatic joint at every timestep.

I think there could be a message if you try to call GetForceTorque on an unsupported joint, but CacheForceTorque shouldn't generate messages if it's always called.

pull_request.title: Fix force torque unit test issue #813

pullrequest.title: Fix force torque unit test issue #813

content.raw:
Calling `CacheForceTorque()` here leads to console spam at every time step for certain joints. For example, any model with joint types other than revolute or prismatic will have messages similar to those below for every physics time step:
~~~
Error [BulletJoint.cc:203] force torque for joint type [4160] not implemented, returns false results!!
Error [BulletJoint.cc:203] force torque for joint type [4160] not implemented, returns false results!!
Error [BulletJoint.cc:203] force torque for joint type [4160] not implemented, returns false results!!
Error [BulletJoint.cc:203] force torque for joint type [4160] not implemented, returns false results!!
~~~
content.html:
Calling CacheForceTorque() here leads to console spam at every time step for certain joints. For example, any model with joint types other than revolute or prismatic will have messages similar to those below for every physics time step:

Error [BulletJoint.cc:203] force torque for joint type [4160] not implemented, returns false results!!
Error [BulletJoint.cc:203] force torque for joint type [4160] not implemented, returns false results!!
Error [BulletJoint.cc:203] force torque for joint type [4160] not implemented, returns false results!!
Error [BulletJoint.cc:203] force torque for joint type [4160] not implemented, returns false results!!

content.raw:
I ran the commented-out tests using bullet (svn: r2645) compiled with:
~~~
cmake .. -G "Unix Makefiles" \
  -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON \
  -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug \
  -DUSE_DOUBLE_PRECISION=ON
~~~
I am still reviewing the code changes. I have made some style fixes and reduced some console output in cfeca79 (branch force_torque_test_scpeters). Please consider merging with that branch.

Also don't forget the new quick-check tool: `tools/bitbucket_pullrequests -c 673`

  -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON \
  -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug \
  -DUSE_DOUBLE_PRECISION=ON

I am still reviewing the code changes. I have made some style fixes and reduced some console output in cfeca79 (branch force_torque_test_scpeters). Please consider merging with that branch.

pull_request.title: Fix force torque unit test issue #813

pullrequest.title: Fix force torque unit test issue #813

content.raw: I've commented out failed bullet tests for now, I think it would be nice to get this merged as it contains fixes to the unit test itself.  The original unit test had an error that it was not testing the force torque values correctly when the parent link is the "world" link.  In addition, I moved mechanism to accumulate/save applied force in each time step from `Joint` class into `ODEJoint` and `BulletJoint` since these are custom mechanisms used by these physics engines, and removed a race condition from it.  Additional cleanups included removing repeated velocity and effort limiting code blocks for each joint type into the parent class.
content.html: I've commented out failed bullet tests for now, I think it would be nice to get this merged as it contains fixes to the unit test itself. The original unit test had an error that it was not testing the force torque values correctly when the parent link is the "world" link. In addition, I moved mechanism to accumulate/save applied force in each time step from Joint class into ODEJoint and BulletJoint since these are custom mechanisms used by these physics engines, and removed a race condition from it. Additional cleanups included removing repeated velocity and effort limiting code blocks for each joint type into the parent class.

pull_request.title: Fix force torque unit test issue #813

update.description: Need trunk of Bullet 2 (bullet 2.82) for the [static force torque test](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/ac74cc7391096beccd6bd420ff354df4e73c8e9b/gazebo/physics/Joint_TEST.cc?at=force_torque_test#cl-28) to pass.  Bullet fails to settle down in the [dynamic joint force torque test](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/ac74cc7391096beccd6bd420ff354df4e73c8e9b/gazebo/physics/Joint_TEST.cc?at=force_torque_test#cl-239), still investigating why there's a lot more oscillatory response to the PID controller.  Potentially the explicit joint damping is less stable then implicit damping in ODE or Simbody.
update.title: Fix force torque unit tests in bullet.  Fix explicit joint damping in bullet.

pullrequest.title: Fix force torque unit test issue #813

content.raw:
We shouldn't commit code that causes test to fail. We won't be able to tell when tests are correctly reporting errors, and we'll be more inclined to ignore test results. 

If this pull request needs bullet 2.82, then we should only accept this pull-request when that version of bullet is released.
content.html:
We shouldn't commit code that causes test to fail. We won't be able to tell when tests are correctly reporting errors, and we'll be more inclined to ignore test results.

If this pull request needs bullet 2.82, then we should only accept this pull-request when that version of bullet is released.
